content.text:
# Timeline of space exploration__disambig_1

This is a timeline of space exploration which includes notable missions, achievements, first accomplishments and milestones in humanity's exploration of outer space.
This timeline generally does not distinguish achievements by a specific country or private company, as it considers humanity as a whole. See otherwise the timeline of private spaceflight or look for achievements by each space agency.
Pre-20th century
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Date

|-

|| 1903
|| Publication of Exploration of the Universe with Rocket-Propelled Vehicles that showed physical space exploration was theoretically possible, including the Tsiolkovsky rocket equation, multi staged rockets and using liquid oxygen and liquid hydrogen in liquid propellant

|-

||Apollo 13
| further from the lunar far side than other Apollo lunar missions, but this was a minor contribution to the record. A reconstruction of the trajectory by astrodynamicist Daniel Adamo in 2009 records the furthest distance as  at 7:34 pm EST (00:34:13 UTC). Apollo 10 holds the record for second-furthest at a distance of .}}
